meanings.definition: To grow or develop beneath the surface or out of sight.
meanings.sent1: The seeds were underbudding in the soil, waiting for the right conditions to sprout.
meanings.sent2: The roots of the tree were underbudding deep underground, unseen by anyone.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky squirrel was underbudding its acorns in various hiding spots around the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for painting was underbudding quietly, soon to bloom into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The idea for the story was underbudding in her mind, slowly taking shape before she put it on paper.

meanings.definition: A method of plant propagation involving the insertion of a bud beneath the bark of a plant.
meanings.sent1: The gardener used underbudding to create new rose bushes from existing ones.
meanings.sent2: Underbudding is a common technique used by horticulturists to develop stronger plants.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbit tried underbudding a carrot into the ground, hoping it would grow faster.
meanings.sent4: The concept of underbudding in plants is like planting a secret that blossoms into a new life.
meanings.sent5: The art of underbudding allows for the creation of unique plant hybrids with desirable traits.
